Q:
Our company has 4 computers connected by several communication links. These computers are named: Server Redwood, Server Blackwood, Server Lighthouse and Server Ironclad. 
To ensure network security, we need to install monitoring devices (such as firewalls or intrusion detection systems) on some of these computers so that all communication links are monitored. 
Assume that the connections between the computers (i.e., the communication links) are bidirectional. This means that information can flow in both directions across any link. Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Redwood is connected with Server Blackwood. 
Server Blackwood is connected with Server Lighthouse. 
Server Lighthouse is connected with Server Ironclad.

Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Oceanview is connected with Server Lighthouse. 
Server Firestorm is connected with Server Lighthouse, Server Solarflare.

Our company has 4 computers connected by several communication links. These computers are named: Server Thunderstrike, Server Redwood, Server Bluebird and Server Ironclad. 
To ensure network security, we need to install monitoring devices (such as firewalls or intrusion detection systems) on some of these computers so that all communication links are monitored. 
Assume that the connections between the computers (i.e., the communication links) are bidirectional. This means that information can flow in both directions across any link. Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Thunderstrike is connected with Server Bluebird, Server Ironclad. 
Server Redwood is connected with Server Bluebird.
